[[Dualtone Records|Dualtone]] | associated_acts = [[Shooter Jennings]] | website = {{URL|tedrussellkamp.com}} | module = | module2 = | module3 = }} '''Ted Russell Kamp''' is an American singer-songwriter. He is the bassist for [[Shooter Jennings]]' backing band. As a solo artist, Kamp has released 11 albums. ==Biography== Born in New York, Kamp grew up in the Northeast U.S. before moving to Seattle where he began his music career. He fronted a trio, Ponticello, which released four albums. During this time, Kamp released his first solo album, ''Dedications'' (1996). Kamp moved to Los Angeles in 2001 and started a new group, Union Pacific. He performed with other bands and worked as a session musician before being hired as the bassist for Shooter Jennings' band, the .357s.{{cite web|last=Ruhlmann|first=William|title=Artist Biography |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/ted-russell-kamp-mn0000053934/biography|website=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=May 30, 2017}} Kamp also continued his solo career, with his album Divisadero{{cite web|title=Album Review: Ted Russell Kamp - Divisadero|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/divisadero-mw0000565354 |website=Allmusic|accessdate=May 30, 2017}} {{cite journal | date=March–April 2007| title=Album Review: Ted Russell Kamp - Divisadero | last = Berick | first = Michael | journal=[[No Depression (magazine)|No Depression]]| volume=1| issue=68 | url=http://nodepression.com/album-review/ted-russell-kamp-divisadero| issn=1088-4971| accessdate=May 30, 2017}} ranked as #34 on the [[Americana Music Association]]'s 2007 chart. In 2011, Kamp released Get Back to the Land,{{cite web|title=Album Review: Ted Russell Kamp - Get Back to the Land|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/get-back-to-the-land-mw0002092965 |website=Allmusic|accessdate=May 30, 2017}} which made the top 25 on the Americana Radio Chart and was #1 on the Euro Americana Chart. In January 2013, Kamp released Night Owl,{{cite magazine|title=Music: Ted Russell Kamp - Night Owl|url=http://www.popmatters.com/review/170077-ted-russell-kamp-night-owl/ |magazine=[[PopMatters]]|accessdate=May 30, 2017}} which made the US Americana Radio Chart (#34) and the Euro Americana Chart (#15). Kamp self-released ''The Low and Lonesome Sound'' in 2015, followed a year later by the acoustic album ''Flying Solo''.{{cite magazine|title=Music: Ted Russell Kamp - The Low and Lonesome Sound|url=http://www.popmatters.com/review/ted-russell-kamp-the-low-and-lonesome-sound/ |magazine=PopMatters|accessdate=May 30, 2017}}{{cite web|title=Bassist Ted Russell Kamp, Flying Solo...|date=8 April 2016 |url=http://bassmusicianmagazine.com/2016/04/flying-solo-featuring-bassist-ted-russell-kamp/ |publisher=[[Bass Musician]]|accessdate=May 30, 2017}} He joined Ted Wulfers to record the classic song Tulsa Time to help support the Red Cross of Oklahoma. 100% of the proceeds were donated to The Oklahoma Red Cross. Kamp is also an established producer in the music industry. ==Discography== ===Solo albums=== * 1996: ''Dedications'' (Poetry Of The Moment [PoMo]) * 2005: ''Northsouth'' (PoMo) * 2005: ''The Ponticello Years'' (Kufala) * 2006: ''Nashville Fineline'' (Kufala) * 2007: ''Divisadero'' (PoMo) * 2008: ''Poor Man's Paradise'' ([[Dualtone Records|Dualtone]] / PoMo) * 2010: ''California Country Soul, Vol. 2 : Ballads'' (PoMo) * 2011: ''Get Back To The Land'' ([[Dualtone Records|Dualtone]] / PoMo) * 2013: ''Night Owl'' (PoMo) * 2015: ''The Low and Lonesome Sound'' (self-released via [[CD Baby]]) * 2016: ''Flying Solo'' [Audio & Video Labs, Inc.) * 2019: ''Walkin' Shoes'' (PoMo Records) ===With [[Shooter Jennings]]=== * 2005: ''[[Put the "O" Back in Country]]'' ([[Show Dog-Universal Music|Universal South]]) * 2006: ''[[Electric Rodeo (Shooter Jennings album)|Electric Rodeo]]'' ([[Show Dog-Universal Music|Universal South]]) * 2006: ''[[Live at Irving Plaza 4.18.06]]'' ([[Show Dog-Universal Music|Universal South]]) * 2014: ''Don't Wait Up (For George)'' EP ([[Black Country Rock Media|Black Country Rock]]) * 2016: ''[[Black Ribbons]]'' ([[Black Country Rock Media|Black Country Rock]]) * 2016: ''[[Countach (For Giorgio)]]'' ([[Black Country Rock Media|Black Country Rock]]) ===As primary artist/song contributor=== * 2009: various artists -
